Whether you're prepping for a big weekend, or recovering from a killer hangover, there is something amazing about an all-you-can-eat reastaurant. 
Manchester has plenty of bountiful buffets to choose from, and they're not your typical all-you-can-eats. Plenty of restaurants offer special unlimited deals, and don't even get us started on the bottomless brunch craze which is sweeping the city. 
Here are the best all-you-can-eat deals and restaurants across Manchester. 
And remember, all you can eat is not a challenge. Tariff and Dale, Dale Street Stonefired pizza oven at Tariff & Dale 
The hip Northern Quarter hangout is offering all-you-can-eat pizza to hungry customers on Friday. Enjoy unlimited slices and a soft drink for £7, or upgrade to a beer or wine for £9. Their #GIROPIZZA offer is available from 12.30pm to 2.30pm. What a way to kick start the weekend. My Thai, John Dalton Street (Photo: My Thai) 
There's nothing like some spicy food to cure a hangover, and the My Thai Sunday buffet does not dissapoint. Available from 12pm to 5pm, tuck into the best of the menu from the buffet cart, and choose from a noodle dish made to order for £7.95 per person Ziferblat , Edge Street Ziferblat in Liverpool (Photo: Gavin Trafford) 
Time is money, as the saying goes, and that’s the simple concept behind Ziferblat, where all you pay for is how long you stay. The drinks flow freely and you can help yourself to all the cakes, crumpets and biscuits you like while surfing the superfast wifi, uninterrupted. 
All it will cost you is a flat rate of 5p per minute, so you can indulge in as much cake as you like. 
Ziferblat / ziferblat.co.uk Fazenda, Spinningfields 
Fazenda is not your typical all-you-can-eat; they're a classy bunch. But you can still gorge yourself on as much of the Brazilian barbecued meat as you like, and flip a token over when you want a breather. 
The wine list is impressive, but not included in the dining price, of £29.50 for an evening meal, £17.50 for lunchtime on weekdays and £19.50 for lunchtime on weekends and bank holidays. 
Fazenda / fazenda.co.uk Royal Nawaab, Stockport Road 
Set on the main road running through Levenshulme, it's impossible to miss the huge Nawaab building. The banquet hall is often home to weddings and celebrations, but there's also an excellent all-you-can-eat buffet serving Indian and Pakistani food. For £14.95 a head tuck into as much samosa, curry, and sweet treats as you like. Morley Cheek's, Barlow Moor Road Morley Cheek's (Photo: Morley Cheek's) 
Every Wednesday it's all you can eat chicken wings at the Chorlton bar Morley Cheek's. Get your wing fix for £10 per person every Wednesday from 6pm to 9pm. 
Any we've missed off the list? let us know in the comments section or email lucy.lovell@trinitymirror.com Like us on Facebook
